alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 14 at 1:11PM MST until February 15 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TO 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ TUESDAY FOR VERY HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER ALONG WITH VERY WINDY, AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR THE GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS AND SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS... The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a Red Flag Warning which is in effect from noon CST /11 AM MST/ to 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Dawson county, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains. * TIMING...Tuesday afternoon through early Tuesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 to 50 mph, except 20 to 25 mph Dawson county. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent, except 13 percent Dawson county. * RFTI...6 to 7 or critical to extreme, except 3 near critical Dawson County.
info.instruction: A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.
